result.execSummary:
The defendant Joann M. Imhoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of $100.00 fine + costs + DNA Surcharge- payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances, including THC, without a valid prescription and only with prior agent approval. No contact with known dealers or users, unless in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval. May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent, including AODA and Mental Health. DNA Sample Due: 04-04-22.

timeConds.notes: 45 days conditional jail time, without good time but with huber if in compliance with jail rules and regulations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
03:47 PM Defendant Joann M. Imhoff in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joann M. Imhoff in custody.
Court calls case. 
Atty provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty agrees.
DA reads charge on Count 1. 
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters No Contest Plea. 
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
Court reviews maximum penalties with party to crime enhancer. 
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty on Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2, 3 and 4. 
DA heard on recommendation and sentencing.
Atty heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court impose and stayed: 1 Year 6 Months IC, 2 Years ES, and places deft on probation for 3 years. 
Not eligible for CIP.
SAP eligible.
Conditions of probation: 
Payment of $100.00 Fine + Costs + DNA surcharge= payment to be worked out with agent. 
45 days conditional jail time without good time, but with huber privileges if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. 
41 days credit for time served. 
No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance, including THC, without a valid RX and only with prior agent approval. 
No contact with known dealers or users, unless in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval. 
Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent, including AODA and Mental Health. 
DNA Sample Due: 4-4-2022.
Appeal rights. 
4:21 PM

03:00 PM Defendant Joann M. Imhoff in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Joann M. Imhoff in custody.   DA DeShea Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joann M. Imhoff appeared by video means.
Copy of info
Waives reading
Pleads n/g
Requests STC
Attorney Hansen heard.
Court informs bond will be addressed by Branch 1.
3:04PM
  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 03:50 pm.

Defendant Joann M. Imhoff appeared by video means with Attorney Brad Hansen. Deft in custody at Marinette County Jail. Prosecuting Atty DeShea D. Morrow appeared for State of Wisconsin.
3:08 p.m.
Prelim Questionnaire/Waiver has been signed - Atty Hansen will file today.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
Atty Hansen wishes to address bond.
Court advises Atty Hansen to schedule bond motion w/JA.
3:13 p.m.
  Arraignment scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

08:36 AM Defendant Joann M. Imhoff in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Joann M. Imhoff in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joann M. Imhoff appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court calls case. 
Atty spks- has reviewed charges and maximum penalities with deft. 
Spks on bond motion. 
DA is being heard. 
Atty responds. 
Court is being heard- denies motion to modify bond. 
Bond will remain with conditions as previously set. 
Court schedules with parties. 
8:42 AM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:41 AM Defendant Joann M. Imhoff in court with attorney Bradley J. Schraven.  Defendant Joann M. Imhoff in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joann M. Imhoff appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court calls case:
Atty Schraven is present for bond purposes.
Atty spks- has reviewed complaint with deft.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties. 
Atty spks- deft does qualify for a public defender but needs to review further to determine it there is a conflict of interest. 
DA is being heard on bond recommendations. 
Atty is being heard on bond recommendations. 
DA argues.
Court imposes: $500 cash bail with conditions, sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances, including THC,  without a valid Rx, and no contact with R.L.
Court schedules with parties. 
11:49 AM
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
